like	O	O
this	O	O
:	O	O

Open	O	O
Replace	O	O
Dialog	O	B-User_Interface_Element

Find	O	O
What	O	O
:	O	O
[	B-Code_Block	B-Value
^	I-Code_Block	I-Value
\[\]]*\[([^\]]+)\]	I-Code_Block	I-Value

Replace	O	O
With	O	O
:	O	O
\1\n	B-Code_Block	B-Value

Check	O	O
regular	O	O
expression	O	O

Click	O	O
Replace	O	O
or	O	O
Replace	O	O
All	O	O

Explanation	O	O

one	O	O
problem	O	O
is	O	O
that	O	O
brackets	O	O
are	O	O
RE	O	O
metacharacters	O	O
,	O	O
that	O	O
means	O	O
we	O	O
have	O	O
to	O	O
escape	O	O
each	O	O
bracket	O	O
,	O	O
when	O	O
we	O	O
need	O	O
a	O	O
literal	O	O
bracket	O	O
,	O	O
i.e	O	O
.	O	O

a	O	O
literal	O	O
bracket	O	O
becomes	O	O
\	B-Code_Block	B-Value
[	I-Code_Block	I-Value
or	O	O
\	B-Code_Block	B-Value
]	I-Code_Block	I-Value
in	O	O
the	O	O
RE	O	O

here	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
RE	O	O
we	O	O
look	O	O
for	O	O
an	O	O
optional	O	O
part	O	O
that	O	O
may	O	O
consist	O	O
of	O	O
everything	O	O
not	O	O
brackets	O	O
(	O	O
[	B-Code_Block	B-Value
\	I-Code_Block	I-Value
[	I-Code_Block	I-Value
\	I-Code_Block	I-Value
]	I-Code_Block	I-Value
]	B-Code_Block	B-Value
*)	I-Code_Block	I-Value

followed	O	O
by	O	O
an	O	O
opening	O	O
bracket	O	O
,	O	O
followed	O	O
by	O	O
somthing	O	O
not	O	O
a	O	O
closing	O	O
bracket	O	O
((	B-Code_Block	B-Value
[	I-Code_Block	I-Value
^\	I-Code_Block	I-Value
]	I-Code_Block	I-Value
]	B-Code_Block	B-Value
+))	I-Code_Block	I-Value
which	O	O
is	O	O
also	O	O
captured	O	O
into	O	O
\1	B-Code_Block	B-Value
due	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
parentheses	O	O
,	O	O
for	O	O
reuse	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
substitution	O	O

whatever	O	O
is	O	O
matched	O	O
above	O	O
is	O	O
completely	O	O
replaced	O	O
by	O	O
whatever	O	O
was	O	O
captured	O	O
into	O	O
\1	B-Code_Block	B-Value
followed	O	O
by	O	O
a	O	O
newline	O	O
(	O	O
\n	B-Code_Block	B-Value
)	O	O
,	O	O
when	O	O
you	O	O
need	O	O
windows-style	O	O
lineendings	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
might	O	O
want	O	O
to	O	O
use	O	O
\r\n	B-Code_Block	B-Value
instead	O	O

I	O	O
recently	O	O
found	O	O
out	O	O
that	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
two	O	O
types	O	O
of	O	O

you	O	O
can	O	O
use	O	O
in	O	O
working	O	O
with	O	O

,	O	O
one	O	O
from	O	O
native	O	O
Android	O	B-Operating_System
and	O	O
one	O	O
from	O	O
Leanback	O	B-Library
library	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
need	O	O
to	O	O
use	O	O

one	O	O
from	O	O

in	O	O
order	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O

to	O	O
maintain	O	O
the	O	O
position	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
focused	O	O
element	O	O

middle	O	O

the	O	O
screen	O	B-Device
.	O	O

The	O	O
problem	O	O
is	O	O

operator	O	O

was	O	O

x	O	B-Code_Block

shorthand	O	O
for	O	O
x	O	B-Code_Block
!=	B-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
null	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
?	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block

:	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
y	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block	O
especially	O	O
useful	O	O
when	O	O
x	O	B-Variable
is	O	O

reference	O	O
was	O	O
null	O	B-Value
,	O	O

runtime	O	O
replace	O	O

?	O	O

?	O	O

.	O	O

?	O	B-Code_Block

operator	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O

:	O	O

:	O	O

please	O	O
help	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O

alias	O	I-Code_Block
.	O	O

From	O	O
the	O	O
tutorial	O	O

came	O	O
to	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O

The	O	O
aliases	O	O
you	O	O
see	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
article	O	O
are	O	O
:	O	O

They	O	O
can	O	O
be	O	O
set	O	O
with	O	O
:	O	O

It	O	O
works	O	O
fine	O	O
for	O	O
me	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
think	O	O
part	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
problem	O	O
is	O	O
that	O	O
your	O	O
reading	O	O
it	O	O
too	O	O
literally	O	O
.	O	O

a	O	O

the	O	O

complex	O	O

between	O	O

be	O	O
better	O	O
than	O	O
many	O	O
closures	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
have	O	O
to	O	O
use	O	O
notifications	O	O
when	O	O

objects	O	O

.	O	O

might	O	O

why	O	O
we	O	O
are	O	O
using	O	O
closures	O	O
for	O	O
simple	O	O
cases	O	O
and	O	O
not	O	O
delegates	O	O
or	O	O
notifications	O	O
.	O	O

answer	O	O
is	O	O
that	O	O
closures	O	O
are	O	O
the	O	O
most	O	O
lightweight	O	O
.	O	O

They	O	O
are	O	O
easy	O	O
to	O	O
create	O	O
and	O	O
they	O	O
positively	O	O
affect	O	O
your	O	O
code	O	O
quality	O	O
.	O	O

Let	O	O
's	O	O
consider	O	O
a	O	O
completion	O	O
callback	O	O
.	O	O

you	O	O

.	O	O

for	O	O
delegates	O	O
.	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O

:	O	O

https://github.com/senayar/books	O	O

EDIT	O	O

Also	O	O
,	O	O
sub	O	O
dialogs	O	B-Class
are	O	O
created	O	O
this	O	O
way	O	O
:	O	O

m_subDlg1->Create	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block

Typically	O	O
the	O	O
Memento	O	B-Algorithm
pattern	O	I-Algorithm
is	O	O

to	O	O
implement	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O

The	O	O
implementation	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
Memento	O	B-Algorithm
pattern	O	I-Algorithm
could	O	O
use	O	O
serialisation	O	O
,	O	O

a	O	O

and	O	O

in	O	O
memory	O	O
or	O	O

to	O	O
disk	O	B-Device
.	O	O

When	O	O
reverting	O	O

content	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O

.	O	O

Conversely	O	O

could	O	O

a	O	O
Memento	O	B-Algorithm
pattern	O	I-Algorithm
by	O	O

state	O	O

if	O	O

needs	O	O

.	O	O

This	O	O
method	O	O
does	O	O

use	O	O
serialisation	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
Memento	O	B-Algorithm
pattern	O	I-Algorithm
is	O	O
an	O	O
OO	O	B-Algorithm
design	O	I-Algorithm
pattern	O	I-Algorithm
used	O	O
to	O	O
keep	O	O
previous	O	O

of	O	O
an	O	O

.	O	O

to	O	O

an	O	O
"	O	O

"	O	O

,	O	O
for	O	O
example	O	O
.	O	O

a	O	O

over	O	O
the	O	O

,	O	O

.	O	O

do	O	O

have	O	O
much	O	O
in	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O
have	O	O
different	O	O
<select>	B-Code_Block	B-HTML_XML_Tag

The	O	O
purpose	O	O
of	O	O
std::condition_variable	B-Code_Block	B-Class

to	O	O
wait	O	O
for	O	O

condition	O	B-Class

.	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

%	O	O

.	O	O

the	O	O

rows	O	B-User_Interface_Element
are	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O

.	O	O

CSS	O	B-Language

.	O	O

a	O	O

in	O	O

:	O	O

without	O	O
observable	O	O
,	O	O
with	O	O
observable	O	O

A	O	O
little	O	O
preamble	O	O

puts	O	O
the	O	O
model	O	O
in	O	O

.	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O
say	O	O
viewmodel	O	B-Class
,	O	O

to	O	O

.	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

there	O	O
.	O	O

Demo	O	O

Overview	O	O
:	O	O

I	O	O
have	O	O

.	O	O

software	O	O
can	O	O

or	O	O

.	O	O

Problem	O	O
:	O	O

've	O	O
had	O	O

in	O	O

version	O	O
where	O	O
a	O	O

has	O	O

to	O	O

a	O	O
query	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
found	O	O
that	O	O

on	O	O
the	O	O

nodes	O	B-Data_Structure
clockwise	O	O

topology	O	O
(	O	O

or	O	O

)	O	O

to	O	O
this	O	O

https://docs.datastax.com/en/cassandra/3.0/cassandra/architecture/archDataDistributeReplication.html	O	O

.	O	O

sorted	B-Code_Block	B-Function

I	O	O
am	O	O
developing	O	O
a	O	O

:	O	O

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.datetime_members.aspx	O	O

Imagine	O	O
a	O	O
plane	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
points	O	O
at	O	O
known	O	O
locations	O	O
.	O	O

Most	O	O
are	O	O
clustered	O	O
close	O	O
together	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
some	O	O
are	O	O
outliers	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
large	O	O
areas	O	O
where	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
no	O	O
points	O	O
at	O	O
all	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
have	O	O
multiple	O	O
clients	O	O
who	O	O
can	O	O
view	O	O
the	O	O
plane	O	O
through	O	O
rectangular	O	O
viewports	O	O
.	O	O

Each	O	O
client	O	O
's	O	O
viewport	O	O
may	O	O
be	O	O
of	O	O
different	O	O
dimensions	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
can	O	O
be	O	O
moved	O	O
instantly	O	O
to	O	O
any	O	O
location	O	O
on	O	O
the	O	O
plane	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
clients	O	O
do	O	O
not	O	O
know	O	O
the	O	O
locations	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
points	O	O
;	O	O
only	O	O
the	O	O
server	O	O
does	O	O
.	O	O

When	O	O
a	O	O
client	O	O
connects	O	O
,	O	O
it	O	O
will	O	O
communicate	O	O
the	O	O
size	O	O
of	O	O
its	O	O
viewport	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
server	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
server	O	O
should	O	O
respond	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
location	O	O
where	O	O
one	O	O
or	O	O
more	O	O
points	O	O
will	O	O
be	O	O
visible	O	O
to	O	O
that	O	O
client	O	O
's	O	O
viewport	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
client	O	O
visits	O	O
that	O	O
location	O	O
,	O	O
collects	O	O
data	O	O
from	O	O
visiting	O	O
those	O	O
points	O	O
,	O	O
sends	O	O
that	O	O
data	O	O
back	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
server	O	O
,	O	O
then	O	O
requests	O	O
the	O	O
next	O	O
location	O	O
to	O	O
visit	O	O
.	O	O

This	O	O
continues	O	O
until	O	O
all	O	O
points	O	O
have	O	O
been	O	O
visited	O	O
by	O	O
at	O	O
least	O	O
one	O	O
client	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
need	O	O
an	O	O
efficient	O	O
algorithm	O	O
that	O	O
will	O	O
choose	O	O
the	O	O
locations	O	O
to	O	O
visit	O	O
.	O	O

An	O	O
ideal	O	O
solution	O	O
will	O	O
minimize	O	O
the	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
locations	O	O
that	O	O
clients	O	O
need	O	O
to	O	O
visit	O	O
by	O	O
including	O	O
as	O	O
many	O	O
unvisited	O	O
points	O	O
as	O	O
possible	O	O
within	O	O
a	O	O
viewport	O	O
location	O	O
,	O	O
minimizing	O	O
duplicate	O	O
visits	O	O
on	O	O
points	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
not	O	O
visiting	O	O
locations	O	O
with	O	O
no	O	O
unvisited	O	O
points	O	O
.	O	O

Can	O	O
you	O	O
recommend	O	O
an	O	O
algorithm	O	O
?	O	O

To	O	O
do	O	O
this	O	O
:	O	O

I	O	O
have	O	O
2	O	O
FileHandlers	O	B-Class
that	O	O
write	O	O
out	O	O
to	O	O
two	O	O
separate	O	O
files	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
amount	O	O
of	O	O
I/O	O	O
occurring	O	O
is	O	O
slowing	O	O
down	O	O
my	O	O
application	O	O
quite	O	O
a	O	O
bit	O	O
:	O	O

I	O	O
've	O	O
decided	O	O
to	O	O
have	O	O

needed	O	O

.	O	O

ca	O	O

"	O	O

"	O	O

current	O	O

to	O	O

messages	O	O
.	O	O

So	O	O
I	O	O

use	O	O
run()	O	B-Function

of	O	O

to	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O
now	O	O
realise	O	O

only	O	O
takes	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O

,	O	O
which	O	O

just	O	O

+	O	O
message	O	O
.	O	O

My	O	O
traces	O	O
have	O	O
much	O	O
more	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
ca	O	O

simply	O	O
be	O	O
placed	O	O
in	O	O
an	O	O

,	O	O

want	O	O
to	O	O

the	O	O
"	O	O

"	O	O
that	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O

as	O	O

.	O	O

Which	O	O

kinda	O	O
.	O	O

.	O	O

like	O	O

,	O	O

the	O	O

I	O	O
am	O	O

to	O	O

library.For	O	O

The	O	O
reason	O	O
I	O	O
mentioned	O	O
the	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
because	O	O
i	O	O

below	O	O
code	O	O
from	O	O
'	O	O
MyThreadYield	O	B-Function
'	O	O
function	O	O

workes	O	O

but	O	O
doesnt	O	O
do	O	O
the	O	O
intended	O	O
functionality	O	O
.	O	O

getcontext(&(save.context))	O	B-Function
;	O	I-Function

addToQueue(save)	O	B-Function
;	O	I-Function

For	O	O
one	O	O
,	O	O
your	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O	O
is	O	O
not	O	O
thread-safe	O	O
at	O	O
this	O	O
point	O	O
.	O	O

Your	O	O
question	O	O
strongly	O	O
suggests	O	O
that	O	O
this	O	O
code	O	O
will	O	O
be	O	O
used	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O
multi-threaded	O	O
environment	O	O
.	O	O

Having	O	O
a	O	O
non	O	O
thread-safe	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
will	O	O
give	O	O
you	O	O
wrong	O	O
results	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
weird	O	O
things	O	O
can	O	O
happen	O	O
(	O	O
like	O	O
removeFromQueue()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
returning	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
thing	O	O
to	O	O
two	O	O
different	O	O
threads	O	O
,	O	O
or	O	O
addToQueue()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
inserting	O	O
two	O	O
items	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
position	O	O
)	O	O
.	O	O

Aside	O	O
from	O	O
that	O	O
,	O	O
your	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O	O
would	O	O
never	O	O
work	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
are	O	O
not	O	O
using	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
and	O	O
rear	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
correctly	O	O
.	O	O

Look	O	O
carefully	O	O
at	O	O
the	O	O
insert	O	O
function	O	O
:	O	O

You	O	O
check	O	O
if	O	O
rear	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
is	O	O
MAX	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
,	O	O
yet	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
write	O	O
into	O	O
queue[front]	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
and	O	O
increment	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
.	O	O

What	O	O
if	O	O
I	O	O
just	O	O
keep	O	O
adding	O	O
items	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
queue	O	O
,	O	O
eventually	O	O
reaching	O	O
the	O	O
buffer	O	O
's	O	O
limit	O	O
?	O	O

rear	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
will	O	O
always	O	O
be	O	O
0	O	B-Value
,	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
will	O	O
grow	O	O
indefinitely	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
your	O	O
function	O	O
will	O	O
write	O	O
beyond	O	O
the	O	O
limits	O	O
of	O	O
queue	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Structure
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
probably	O	O
the	O	O
cause	O	O
of	O	O
your	O	O
segmentation	O	B-Error_Name
fault	O	I-Error_Name
errors	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
think	O	O
you	O	O
wanted	O	O
to	O	O
check	O	O
for	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
instead	O	O
:	O	O

The	O	O
code	O	O
for	O	O
removeFromQueue()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
looks	O	O
superficially	O	O
ok	O	O
,	O	O
as	O	O
long	O	O
as	O	O
queue	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Structure
is	O	O
a	O	O
global	O	B-Data_Type
array	O	B-Data_Structure
(	O	O
since	O	O
you	O	O
're	O	O
returning	O	O
a	O	O
pointer	O	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
and	O	O
ca	O	O
n't	O	O
return	O	O
pointers	O	B-Data_Type
to	O	O
local	O	O
variables	O	O
)	O	O
.	O	O

However	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
single	O	O
,	O	O
most	O	O
important	O	O
fact	O	O
you	O	O
have	O	O
to	O	O
take	O	O
out	O	O
of	O	O
this	O	O
answer	O	O
,	O	O
is	O	O
that	O	O
your	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
implementation	O	O
will	O	O
not	O	O
scale	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
long-term	O	O
.	O	O

An	O	O
array-based	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
is	O	O
a	O	O
terrible	O	O
choice	O	O
.	O	O

What	O	O
do	O	O
you	O	O
do	O	O
when	O	O
you	O	O
run	O	O
out	O	O
of	O	O
space	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
array	O	B-Data_Structure
?	O	O

What	O	O
if	O	O
I	O	O
insert	O	O
MAX	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
elements	O	O
,	O	O
then	O	O
remove	O	O
2	O	B-Value
or	O	O
3	O	B-Value
,	O	O
and	O	O
try	O	O
to	O	O
insert	O	O
more	O	O
?	O	O

Your	O	O
code	O	O
will	O	O
say	O	O
the	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
is	O	O
full	O	O
,	O	O
because	O	O
it	O	O
only	O	O
ever	O	O
allows	O	O
you	O	O
to	O	O
insert	O	O
MAX	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
elements	O	O
in	O	O
total	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
could	O	O
shift	O	O
every	O	O
element	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
to	O	O
the	O	O
left	O	O
when	O	O
an	O	O
element	O	O
is	O	O
removed	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
that	O	O
's	O	O
crazy	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
extremely	O	O
inefficient	O	O
.	O	O

Or	O	O
you	O	O
could	O	O
increment	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
modulo	O	O
MAX	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
,	O	O
allowing	O	O
rear	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
to	O	O
be	O	O
ahead	O	O
of	O	O
front	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
,	O	O
as	O	O
long	O	O
as	O	O
you	O	O
know	O	O
that	O	O
no	O	O
more	O	O
than	O	O
MAX	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
elements	O	O
can	O	O
be	O	O
inserted	O	O
.	O	O

That	O	O
would	O	O
be	O	O
better	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
it	O	O
would	O	O
break	O	O
the	O	O
logic	O	O
in	O	O
removeFromQueue()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
,	O	O
since	O	O
the	O	O
pointers	O	B-Data_Type
returned	O	O
earlier	O	O
will	O	O
possibly	O	O
point	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
different	O	O
thread	O	O
struct	O	B-Data_Structure
as	O	O
you	O	O
manipulate	O	O
the	O	O
queue	O	B-Data_Structure
-	O	O
total	O	O
disaster	O	O
.	O	O

Definitely	O	O
not	O	O
what	O	O
you	O	O
want	O	O

is	O	O
the	O	O
method	O	O
.	O	O

Your	O	O
code	O	O

a	O	O

1	O	B-Value

can	O	O

your	O	O

:	O	O

The	O	O

method	O	O
has	O	O
an	O	O
overload	O	O
which	O	O
takes	O	O
an	O	O

as	O	O
the	O	O
first	O	O
parameter	O	O
.	O	O

Here	O	O
is	O	O

https://stackoverflow.com/a/20098381/2190520	O	O

I	O	O
've	O	O
been	O	O
using	O	O

for	O	O
some	O	O
time	O	O
already	O	O
and	O	O
it	O	O
never	O	O
stopped	O	O

after	O	O
some	O	O

like	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
case	O	O
.	O	O

After	O	O
I	O	O
open	O	O
my	O	O
app	O	O

the	O	O
first	O	O

works	O	O

and	O	O

can	O	O
execute	O	O

many	O	O
times	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
problem	O	O
is	O	O
after	O	O
I	O	O
close	O	O
my	O	O
app	O	O
and	O	O
put	O	O
device	O	O

minutes	O	O

becomes	O	O

to	O	O

.	O	O

Usually	O	O

for	O	O

but	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O

takes	O	O
for	O	O
a	O	O
couple	O	O
of	O	O
minutes	O	O
.	O	O

This	O	O
is	O	O
my	O	O
AsyncTask	O	B-Class
:	O	O

that	O	O
when	O	O

back	B-Code_Block	B-Keyboard_IP

is	O	O

inside	O	O

block	O	O

UPDATE1	O	O

Now	O	O
I	O	O
noticed	O	O
that	O	O

:	O	O

i	O	O
have	O	O
this	O	O
file	O	O
and	O	O
on	O	O
a	O	O

it	O	O

a	O	O

function	O	O
through	O	O
$.post{}	B-Code_Block	B-Function

i	O	O
have	O	O
used	O	O

to	O	O

errors	O	O
.	O	O

,	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

I	O	O

lost	O	O
here	O	O
no	O	O
idea	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
solve	O	O
this	O	O
without	O	O
any	O	O
errors	O	O
displaying.	O	O
.	O	O
Help	O	O
much	O	O
appreciated	O	O
.	O	O

p.s	O	O
in	O	O
php	O	B-Language
info	O	O
error	O	O
reporting	O	O
is	O	O
off	O	O
.	O	O

i	O	O
tried	O	O
htaccess	O	B-File_Type
on	O	O
my	O	O
subfolder	O	O
without	O	O
no	O	O
luck	O	O
either	O	O
.	O	O

Make	O	O
sure	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
following	O	O
:	O	O

error_reporting(E_ALL)	B-Code_Block	B-Function
is	O	O
right	O	O
after	O	O
<	B-Code_Block	B-HTML_XML_Tag
?	I-Code_Block	I-HTML_XML_Tag

LINQ	O	B-Library
is	O	O
just	O	O
so	O	O
damn	O	O
efficient	O	O
that	O	O
it	O	O
can	O	O
be	O	O
hard	O	O
to	O	O
debug	O	O
when	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
problems	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
.Single()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
is	O	O
what	O	O
's	O	O
throwing	O	O
the	O	O
exception	O	B-Class
.	O	O

Either	O	O
your	O	O
query	O	O
is	O	O
returning	O	O
no	O	O
items	O	O
or	O	O
it	O	O
's	O	O
returning	O	O
>	O	O
1	O	O
item	O	O
.	O	O

If	O	O
you	O	O
're	O	O
not	O	O
sure	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
items	O	O
you	O	O
're	O	O
expecting	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
should	O	O
be	O	O
using	O	O
FirstOrDefault()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
which	O	O
will	O	O
return	O	O
the	O	O
first	O	O
match	O	O
or	O	O
null	O	B-Value
if	O	O
no	O	O
matches	O	O
are	O	O
found	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
non-LINQ	O	B-Library
equivalent	O	O
is	O	O
something	O	O
like	O	O
this	O	O

It	O	O
's	O	O
basically	O	O
doing	O	O
this	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
your	O	O
version	O	O
,	O	O
try	O	O
replacing	O	O
.Single()	O	B-Function
with	O	O
.FirstOrDefault()	O	B-Function
.	O	O

It	O	O
's	O	O
failing	O	O
because	O	O
there	O	O
is	O	O
no	O	O
match	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
am	O	O
running	O	O
two	O	O
http/2	O	O
servers	O	B-Application
on	O	O
my	O	O
ubuntu	O	B-Operating_System
server	O	B-Application
.	O	O

Both	O	O
should	O	O
be	O	O
reachable	O	O
over	O	O
port	O	B-Device
443	O	B-Value
.	O	O

Is	O	O
there	O	O
a	O	O
simple	O	O
way	O	O
to	O	O
do	O	O
this	O	O
on	O	O
Ubuntu	O	B-Operating_System
?	O	O

Yes	O	O
this	O	O
is	O	O
possible	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
need	O	O
to	O	O
run	O	O
a	O	O
webserver	O	B-Application
or	O	O
loadbalancer	O	B-Application
listening	O	O
to	O	O
port	O	B-Device
443	O	B-Value
and	O	O
forwarding	O	O
requests	O	O
appropriately	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
Apache	O	B-Application
for	O	O
example	O	O
this	O	O
would	O	O
be	O	O
handled	O	O
as	O	O
follows	O	O
:	O	O

Now	O	O
while	O	O
Apache	O	B-Application
does	O	O
support	O	O
HTTP/2	O	B-Version
in	O	O
both	O	O
the	O	O
front	O	O
end	O	O
client	O	O
connections	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
back	O	O
end	O	O
ProxyPass	O	O
requests	O	O
(	O	O
with	O	O
mod_proxy_http	O	B-Code_Block
2)	O	I-Code_Block
,	O	O
some	O	O
other	O	O
webservers/loadbalancers	O	B-Application
do	O	O
n't	O	O
(	O	O
e.g	O	O
.	O	O
Nginx	O	B-Application
)	O	O
.	O	O

To	O	O
be	O	O
honest	O	O
most	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
benefits	O	O
for	O	O
HTTP/2	O	B-Version
are	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
client	O	O
to	O	O
edge	O	O
.	O	O

So	O	O
if	O	O
you	O	O
prefer	O	O
to	O	O
use	O	O
Nginx	O	B-Application
for	O	O
example	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
could	O	O
just	O	O
have	O	O
Nginx	O	B-Application
support	O	O
HTTP/2	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
the	O	O
connection	O	O
from	O	O
Nginx	O	B-Application
to	O	O
your	O	O
back	O	O
end	O	O
apps	O	O
be	O	O
plain	O	O
old	O	O
HTTP/1.1	O	B-Version
.	O	O

At	O	O
least	O	O
until	O	O
HTTP/2	O	B-Version
becomes	O	O
more	O	O
regularly	O	O
supported	O	O
.	O	O

See	O	O
here	O	O
for	O	O
more	O	O
discussion	O	O
on	O	O
this	O	O
:	O	O
HTTP2	O	B-Version
with	O	O
node.js	O	B-Application
behind	O	O
nginx	O	B-Application
proxy	O	O

I	O	O
am	O	O
a	O	O
new	O	O
user	O	O
of	O	O
Json.net	O	B-Library
and	O	O
I	O	O
am	O	O
stuck	O	O
because	O	O
of	O	O
an	O	O
error	O	O
message	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
want	O	O
to	O	O
read	O	O
a	O	O
json	O	B-File_Type
file	O	O
thanks	O	O
to	O	O
JsonTextReader	O	B-Class
using	O	O
json.net	O	B-Library

My	O	O
json	O	B-File_Type
file	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
list	O	O
of	O	O
my	O	O
class	O	O
Person	O	B-Class
with	O	O
some	O	O
attributes	O	O
looks	O	O
like	O	O
that	O	O
:	O	O

http://pastebin.com/DbSDVt2K	O	O

When	O	O
reading	O	O
with	O	O
the	O	O
StreamReader	O	B-Class
(	O	O
or	O	O
TextReader	O	B-Class
)	O	O
I	O	O
have	O	O
no	O	O
problem	O	O
.	O	O

What	O	O
i	O	O
want	O	O
is	O	O
to	O	O
have	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
result	O	O
with	O	O
an	O	O
output	O	O

is	O	O
the	O	O
highest	O	O

will	O	O
hold	O	O
and	O	O
what	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
lowest	O	O
in	O	O
this	O	O
code	O	O
:	O	O

Random	O	B-Code_Block
rand	O	I-Code_Block
=	O	I-Code_Block
new	O	I-Code_Block
Random()	O	I-Code_Block
;	O	I-Code_Block

int	O	B-Code_Block
x	O	I-Code_Block
=	O	I-Code_Block
1	O	I-Code_Block
-	O	I-Code_Block
rand.Next()%15	O	I-Code_Block
;	O	I-Code_Block

I	O	O
have	O	O
entered	O	O
this	O	O
and	O	O
receive	O	O
a	O	O
value	O	O
of	O	O
-12	O	B-Value
as	O	O
a	O	O
result	O	O
but	O	O
cannot	O	O
get	O	O
a	O	O
range	O	O
.	O	O

rand.Next()	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
%	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
15	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
will	O	O
give	O	O
you	O	O
a	O	O
number	O	O
between	O	O
0	O	B-Value
and	O	O
14	O	B-Value
.	O	O

(	O	O
If	O	O
we	O	O
assume	O	O
that	O	O
it	O	O
generates	O	O
only	O	O
positive	O	O
integers	O	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
otherwise	O	O
you	O	O
can	O	O
use	O	O
do	O	O
it	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
negative	O	O
number	O	O
too	O	O
take	O	O
a	O	O
look	O	O
here	O	O
how	O	O
:	O	O

https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/519845/modulo-of-a-negative-number	O	O

Then	O	O
add	O	O
the	O	O
1	O	B-Code_Block
-	O	I-Code_Block
{	O	I-Code_Block
a	O	I-Code_Block
number	O	I-Code_Block
from	O	I-Code_Block
the	O	I-Code_Block
set	O	I-Code_Block
of	O	I-Code_Block
0	O	I-Code_Block
and	O	I-Code_Block
14}	O	I-Code_Block
and	O	O
you	O	O
get	O	O
your	O	O
answer	O	O
.	O	O

However	O	O
pay	O	O
attention	O	O
that	O	O
"rand.Next()	O	B-Code_Block
%	O	I-Code_Block
15	O	I-Code_Block
"	O	O
is	O	O
equal	O	O
to	O	O

Ruby	O	B-Language
is	O	O
an	O	O
object-oriented	O	O
language	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
an	O	O
object-oriented	O	O
language	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
send	O	O
messages	O	O
to	O	O
objects	O	O
and	O	O
those	O	O
objects	O	O
then	O	O
respond	O	O
to	O	O
those	O	O
messages	O	O
however	O	O
they	O	O
see	O	O
fit	O	O
.	O	O

This	O	O
means	O	O
that	O	O
the	O	O
receiver	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
message	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
only	O	O
the	O	O
receiver(!)	O	O

is	O	O
in	O	O
total	O	O
control	O	O
of	O	O
what	O	O
a	O	O
message	O	O
means	O	O
.	O	O

With	O	O
some	O	O
operators	O	O
,	O	O
however	O	O
,	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
certain	O	O
expectations	O	O
of	O	O
symmetry	O	O
:	O	O
for	O	O
example	O	O
,	O	O
a	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
b	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
is	O	O
expected	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
as	O	O
b	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
a	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
.	O	O

But	O	O
in	O	O
an	O	O
OO	O	O
language	O	O
that	O	O
is	O	O
impossible	O	O
!	O	O

Either	O	O
a	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
or	O	O
b	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
must	O	O
be	O	O
the	O	O
receiver	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
message	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
in	O	O
one	O	O
case	O	O
a	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
gets	O	O
to	O	O
decide	O	O
whether	O	O
a	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
and	O	O
b	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
are	O	O
equal	O	O
and	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
other	O	O
case	O	O
b	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
gets	O	O
to	O	O
decide	O	O
.	O	O

They	O	O
might	O	O
decide	O	O
differently	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
then	O	O
the	O	O
expectation	O	O
of	O	O
symmetry	O	O
would	O	O
be	O	O
broken	O	O
.	O	O

So	O	O
,	O	O
in	O	O
some	O	O
classes	O	O
equality	O	O
is	O	O
actually	O	O
implemented	O	O
something	O	O
like	O	O
this	O	O
:	O	O

Here	O	O
's	O	O
an	O	O
example	O	O
:	O	O
if	O	O
you	O	O
write	O	O
your	O	O
own	O	O
Numeric	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
(	O	O
say	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
)	O	O
,	O	O
then	O	O
the	O	O
system	O	O
builtin	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
does	O	O
n't	O	O
know	O	O
anything	O	O
about	O	O
Quaternions	B-Code_Block	B-Class
.	O	O
So	O	O
,	O	O
when	O	O
you	O	O
ask	O	O
the	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
0	I-Code_Block	O
whether	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
equal	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
(	I-Code_Block	B-Value
0	I-Code_Block	I-Value
,	I-Code_Block	I-Value
0	I-Code_Block	I-Value
,	I-Code_Block	I-Value
0	I-Code_Block	I-Value
,	I-Code_Block	I-Value
0	I-Code_Block	I-Value
)	I-Code_Block	I-Value
,	O	O
it	O	O
will	O	O
responds	O	O
false	B-Code_Block	B-Value
,	O	O
even	O	O
though	O	O
that	O	O
's	O	O
wrong	O	O
.	O	O

So	O	O
,	O	O
instead	O	O
the	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
will	O	O
first	O	O
check	O	O
:	O	O
do	O	O
I	O	O
know	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
compare	O	O
myself	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
?	O	O

No	O	O
,	O	O
I	O	O
do	O	O
n't	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
maybe	O	O
a	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
knows	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
compare	O	O
itself	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
!	O	O

After	O	O
all	O	O
,	O	O
the	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
did	O	O
n't	O	O
exist	O	O
when	O	O
the	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
was	O	O
written	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
the	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
cannot	O	O
know	O	O
about	O	O
Quaternions	B-Code_Block	B-Class
.	O	O
But	O	O
when	O	O
the	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
class	O	O
was	O	O
written	O	O
,	O	O
maybe	O	O
the	O	O
author	O	O
was	O	O
so	O	O
thoughtful	O	O
to	O	O
make	O	O
it	O	O
possible	O	O
to	O	O
compare	O	O
Quaternions	B-Code_Block	B-Class
with	O	O
Fixnums	B-Code_Block	B-Class
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
why	O	O
Fixnum#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
reverses	O	O
the	O	O
arguments	O	O
and	O	O
tries	O	O
again	O	O
.	O	O

With	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
it	O	O
's	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
but	O	O
somewhat	O	O
more	O	O
complicated	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
,	O	O
classes	O	O
are	O	O
n't	O	O
types	O	O
and	O	O
subtyping	O	O
and	O	O
subclassing	O	O
are	O	O
different	O	O
.	O	O

Ruby	O	B-Language
itself	O	O
does	O	O
n't	O	O
have	O	O
a	O	O
concept	O	O
of	O	O
type	O	O
at	O	O
all	O	O
!	O	O

The	O	O
type	O	O
of	O	O
an	O	O
object	O	O
is	O	O
its	O	O
protocol	O	O
,	O	O
i.e	O	O
.	O	O
the	O	O
messages	O	O
it	O	O
understands	O	O
and	O	O
how	O	O
it	O	O
responds	O	O
to	O	O
them	O	O
.	O	O

But	O	O
that	O	O
concept	O	O
is	O	O
not	O	O
recorded	O	O
in	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
(	O	O
unlike	O	O
Objective-C	O	B-Language
,	O	O
for	O	O
example	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
does	O	O
have	O	O
an	O	O
explicit	O	O
notion	O	O
of	O	O
protocol	O	O
)	O	O
.	O	O

There	O	O
,	O	O
however	O	O
,	O	O
some	O	O
cases	O	O
,	O	O
where	O	O
you	O	O
want	O	O
to	O	O
break	O	O
OO	O	O
encapsulation	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
know	O	O
the	O	O
specific	O	O
type	O	O
and	O	O
even	O	O
more	O	O
:	O	O
the	O	O
specific	O	O
representation	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
type	O	O
.	O	O

(	O	O
Note	O	O
:	O	O
this	O	O
violates	O	O
OO	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
sometimes	O	O
necessary	O	O
for	O	O
performance	O	O
.	O	O
)	O	O

In	O	O
cases	O	O
,	O	O
where	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
needs	O	O
an	O	O
object	O	O
to	O	O
be	O	O
of	O	O
a	O	O
specific	O	O
class	O	O
instead	O	O
of	O	O
just	O	O
responding	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
specific	O	O
protocol	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
would	O	O
lose	O	O
a	O	O
lot	O	O
of	O	O
flexibility	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
have	O	O
to	O	O
use	O	O
,	O	O
say	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
even	O	O
though	O	O
you	O	O
would	O	O
much	O	O
rather	O	O
use	O	O
a	O	O
Rope	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
instead	O	O
.	O	O

In	O	O
order	O	O
to	O	O
give	O	O
you	O	O
back	O	O
some	O	O
flexibility	O	O
,	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
allows	O	O
you	O	O
to	O	O
pass	O	O
in	O	O
something	O	O
which	O	O
is	O	O
not	O	O
exactly	O	O
a	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
but	O	O
which	O	O
is	O	O
equivalent	O	O
to	O	O
one	O	O
and	O	O
can	O	O
be	O	O
converted	O	O
to	O	O
one	O	O
with	O	O
a	O	O
to_str	B-Code_Block	B-Function
method	O	O
.	O	O

So	O	O
,	O	O
unlike	O	O
other	O	O
languages	O	O
,	O	O
where	O	O
A	B-Code_Block	B-Value
IS-A	I-Code_Block	I-Value
String	I-Code_Block	I-Value
is	O	O
represented	O	O
by	O	O
A	B-Code_Block	B-Class
being	O	O
a	O	O
subclass	O	O
of	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
in	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
,	O	O
the	O	O
relationship	O	O
A	B-Code_Block	B-Value
IS-A	I-Code_Block	I-Value
String	I-Code_Block	I-Value
is	O	O
represented	O	O
by	O	O
A	B-Code_Block	B-Class
having	O	O
a	O	O
to_str	B-Code_Block	B-Function
method	O	O
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
what	O	O
you	O	O
are	O	O
seeing	O	O
above	O	O
.	O	O

If	O	O
the	O	O
argument	O	O
to	O	O
String#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
is	O	O
n't	O	O
a	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
,	O	O
then	O	O
String#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
does	O	O
n't	O	O
know	O	O
what	O	O
to	O	O
do	O	O
with	O	O
it	O	O
.	O	O

But	O	O
if	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
"	O	O
string-like	O	O
"	O	O
,	O	O
i.e	O	O
.	O	O
it	O	O
implements	O	O
to_str	B-Code_Block	B-Function
,	O	O
then	O	O
maybe	O	O
it	O	O
does	O	O
know	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
compare	O	O
itself	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
String	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
?	O	O

Note	O	O
that	O	O
equality	O	O
is	O	O
very	O	O
hard	O	O
to	O	O
get	O	O
right	O	O
.	O	O

People	O	O
cannot	O	O
even	O	O
agree	O	O
on	O	O
what	O	O
it	O	O
means	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O
purely	O	O
functional	O	O
language	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
that	O	O
's	O	O
the	O	O
easy	O	O
case	O	O
!	O	O

In	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
,	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
two	O	O
additional	O	O
complications	O	O
:	O	O
mutable	O	O
state	O	O
and	O	O
OO	O	O
.	O	O

Mutable	O	O
state	O	O
means	O	O
that	O	O
two	O	O
objects	O	O
that	O	O
were	O	O
equal	O	O
a	O	O
moment	O	O
ago	O	O
may	O	O
not	O	O
be	O	O
equal	O	O
anymore	O	O
a	O	O
couple	O	O
of	O	O
moments	O	O
later	O	O
.	O	O

Or	O	O
should	O	O
they	O	O
be	O	O
?	O	O

Or	O	O
should	O	O
n't	O	O
they	O	O
be	O	O
?	O	O

And	O	O
OO	O	O
means	O	O
that	O	O
equality	O	O
cannot	O	O
be	O	O
symmetric	O	O
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
why	O	O
the	O	O
implementations	O	O
of	O	O
==	B-Code_Block	B-Function
for	O	O
various	O	O
core	O	O
and	O	O
stdlib	O	B-Library
classes	O	O
are	O	O
constantly	O	O
improved	O	O
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
also	O	O
why	O	O
you	O	O
may	O	O
see	O	O
weird	O	O
behavior	O	O
now	O	O
and	O	O
again	O	O
.	O	O

Sometimes	O	O
it	O	O
may	O	O
just	O	O
be	O	O
an	O	O
artifact	O	O
of	O	O
trying	O	O
to	O	O
get	O	O
equality	O	O
right	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
sometimes	O	O
it	O	O
might	O	O
just	O	O
simply	O	O
be	O	O
a	O	O
bug	O	O
.	O	O

By	O	O
the	O	O
way	O	O
:	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
arithmetic	O	O
operators	O	O
,	O	O
subclasses	O	O
of	O	O
Numeric	B-Code_Block	B-Class
actually	O	O
have	O	O
a	O	O
more	O	O
formal	O	O
double-dispatch	O	O
protocol	O	O
using	O	O
the	O	O
coerce	B-Code_Block	B-Function
method	O	O
.	O	O

If	O	O
a	O	O
Numeric	B-Code_Block	B-Class
object	O	O
does	O	O
n't	O	O
know	O	O
what	O	O
to	O	O
do	O	O
with	O	O
another	O	O
Numeric	B-Code_Block	B-Class
,	O	O
it	O	O
will	O	O
ask	O	O
that	O	O
other	O	O
object	O	O
to	O	O
coerce	B-Code_Block	B-Function
the	O	O
two	O	O
objects	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
type	O	O
that	O	O
does	O	O
know	O	O
that	O	O
.	O	O

For	O	O
example	O	O
,	O	O
if	O	O
you	O	O
try	O	O
to	O	O
add	O	O
a	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
to	O	O
a	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
,	O	O
the	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
wo	O	O
n't	O	O
know	O	O
what	O	O
to	O	O
do	O	O
:	O	O

The	O	O
+	B-Code_Block	B-Function
method	O	O
of	O	O
Fixnum	B-Code_Block	B-Class
will	O	O
then	O	O
call	O	O
:	O	O

IOW	O	O
:	O	O
it	O	O
will	O	O
call	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Function
#coerce	I-Code_Block	I-Function
with	O	O
the	O	O
equivalent	O	O
of	O	O

to	O	O
which	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
will	O	O
respond	O	O
with	O	O
an	O	O
Array	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Structure
of	O	O
[	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
Quaternion.new(2,0,0,0)	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
,	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
Quaternion.new(1,0,0,0)	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
]	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block

Then	O	O
,	O	O
Fixnum#+	B-Code_Block	B-Function
will	O	O
try	O	O
again	O	O
by	O	O
simply	O	O
calling	O	O

Which	O	O
will	O	O
now	O	O
work	O	O
because	O	O
a	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
is	O	O
a	O	O
Quaternion	B-Code_Block	B-Class
also	O	O
and	O	O
knows	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
add	O	O
two	O	O
Quaternions	B-Code_Block	B-Class
.	O	O

A	O	O
very	O	O
common	O	O
implementation	O	O
of	O	O
coerce	B-Code_Block	B-Function
is	O	O
simply	O	O
to	O	O
swap	O	O
the	O	O
arguments	O	O
,	O	O
i.e	O	O
.	O	O

That	O	O
's	O	O
equivalent	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
behavior	O	O
you	O	O
are	O	O
seeing	O	O
with	O	O
Fixnum#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
.	O	O

Again	O	O
:	O	O
this	O	O
kind	O	O
of	O	O
dispatch	O	O
is	O	O
hard	O	O
to	O	O
get	O	O
right	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
there	O	O
are	O	O
improvements	O	O
being	O	O
made	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
coerce	B-Code_Block	B-Function
protocol	O	O
.	O	O

Ruby	O	B-Language
has	O	O
four	O	O
levels	O	O
of	O	O
object	O	O
equivalence	O	O
:	O	O

#equal	B-Code_Block	B-Function
?	I-Code_Block	I-Function
–	O	O
same	O	O
object	O	O

#eql	B-Code_Block	B-Function
?	I-Code_Block	I-Function
–	O	O
highest	O	O
level	O	O
of	O	O
equivalence	O	O
below	O	O
same	O	O
object	O	O

#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
–	O	O
"	O	O
standard	O	O
"	O	O
equality	O	O

#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
=	I-Code_Block	I-Function
,	O	O
#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
=	I-Code_Block	I-Function
~	I-Code_Block	I-Function
,	O	O
#hash	B-Code_Block	B-Function
,	O	O
etc	O	O
.	O	O

–	O	O
loose	O	O
equivalence	O	O
,	O	O
"	O	O
same	O	O
group	O	O
"	O	O
equivalence	O	O

Mindful	O	O
programmer	O	O
equips	O	O
each	O	O
of	O	O
her	O	O
classes	O	O
with	O	O
all	O	O
of	O	O
these	O	O
methods	O	O
except	O	O
#equal	B-Code_Block	B-Function
?	I-Code_Block	I-Function
,	O	O
which	O	O
should	O	O
never	O	O
be	O	O
overriden	O	O
.	O	O

Going	O	O
back	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
subject	O	O
of	O	O
your	O	O
question	O	O
,	O	O
many	O	O
built-in	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
objects	O	O
have	O	O
their	O	O
share	O	O
of	O	O
idiosyncrasies	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
implementation	O	O
of	O	O
these	O	O
methods	O	O
.	O	O

Ruby	O	B-Language
core	O	O
team	O	O
constantly	O	O
works	O	O
to	O	O
improve	O	O
them	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
you	O	O
should	O	O
make	O	O
your	O	O
way	O	O
from	O	O
1.8	O	B-Version
to	O	O
2.0	O	B-Version
,	O	O
which	O	O
fixes	O	O
a	O	O
number	O	O
of	O	O
1.8	O	B-Version
problems	O	O
.	O	O

One	O	O
more	O	O
thing	O	O
to	O	O
mention	O	O
with	O	O
#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
method	O	O
,	O	O
is	O	O
that	O	O
for	O	O
the	O	O
classes	O	O
that	O	O
represent	O	O
elements	O	O
of	O	O
ordered	O	O
sets	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
do	O	O
not	O	O
implement	O	O
#	B-Code_Block	B-Function
==	I-Code_Block	I-Function
directly	O	O
,	O	O
but	O	O
instead	O	O
you	O	O
provide	O	O
#<=>	B-Code_Block	B-Function
three-way	O	O
comparison	O	O
method,	O	O
and	O	O
include	O	O
Comparable	B-Code_Block	B-Library
module,	O	O
which	O	O
gives	O	O
you	O	O
for	O	O
free	O	O
methods	O	O
such	O	O
as	O	O
#==,	B-Code_Block	B-Function
#<,	I-Code_Block	I-Function
#>	I-Code_Block	I-Function
,	O	O
#sort	B-Code_Block	B-Function
,	O	O
etc	O	O
.	O	O

Yet	O	O
one	O	O
more	O	O
thing	O	O
to	O	O
mention	O	O
with	O	O
all	O	O
of	O	O
these	O	O
operators	O	O
and	O	O
operator-like	O	O
methods	O	O
,	O	O
be	O	O
mindful	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
existence	O	O
of	O	O
#coerce	B-Code_Block	B-Function
method	O	O
,	O	O
which	O	O
is	O	O
currently	O	O
undergoing	O	O
improvements	O	O
in	O	O
Ruby	O	B-Language
2.0	O	B-Version
.	O	O

I	O	O
have	O	O
a	O	O
web	O	O
application	O	O
and	O	O
it	O	O
has	O	O
two	O	O
controller	O	O
classes	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
two	O	O
controllers	O	O
have	O	O
an	O	O
action	O	O
with	O	O
FormCollection	O	B-Class
parameter	O	O
with	O	O
HTTPPost	O	B-Variable
attribute	O	O
decorated	O	O
.	O	O

If	O	O
I	O	O
click	O	O
on	O	O
Form	O	O
submit	O	O
button	O	B-User_Interface_Element
then	O	O
which	O	O
action	O	O
will	O	O
be	O	O
triggered	O	O
to	O	O
capture	O	O
the	O	O
form	O	B-Class
's	O	O
values	O	O
within	O	O
the	O	O
controller	O	O
.	O	O

Using	O	O
the	O	O
Form	O	B-Class
Collection	O	I-Class
class	O	O
we	O	O
can	O	O
capture	O	O
the	O	O
form	O	B-Class
's	O	O
values	O	O
within	O	O
the	O	O
controller.There	O	O
are	O	O
many	O	O
ways	O	O
to	O	O
fetch	O	O
these	O	O
values	O	O
and	O	O
Form	O	B-Class
Collection	O	I-Class
is	O	O
the	O	O
one	O	O
of	O	O
them	O	O
.	O	O

http://tutorial.techaltum.com/Form-collection-in-MVC.html	O	O

http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/UploadFile/dacca2/understand-formcollection-in-mvc-controller/	O	O

Follow	O	O
above	O	O
link	O	O
It	O	O
will	O	O
help	O	O
you	O	O
to	O	O
understand	O	O
more	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
've	O	O
build	O	O
the	O	O
exoplayer	O	B-Class
ffmpeg	O	B-Application
extension	O	O
and	O	O
added	O	O
to	O	O
my	O	O
project	O	O
,	O	O
because	O	O
i	O	O
need	O	O
to	O	O
support	O	O
AMR	O	B-File_Type
format	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
:	O	O

Following	O	O
the	O	O
tutorial	O	O
:	O	O
FFmpeg	O	B-Application
Extension	O	O

After	O	O
the	O	O
compilation	O	O
step	O	O
:	O	O

I	O	O
've	O	O
generated	O	O
aar	O	B-File_Type
file	O	O
with	O	O
:	O	O

So	O	O
I	O	O
got	O	O
the	O	O
extension-ffmpeg-debug.arr	O	B-File_Name
file	O	O
generated	O	O
and	O	O
put	O	O
it	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
lib	O	B-File_Name
folder	O	O
of	O	O
my	O	O
project	O	O
.	O	O

My	O	O
player	O	O
implementation	O	O
:	O	O

The	O	O
error	O	O
:	O	O

What	O	O
else	O	O
should	O	O
be	O	O
configured	O	O
to	O	O
run	O	O
the	O	O
AMR	O	B-File_Type
format	O	O
,	O	O
does	O	O
anyone	O	O
have	O	O
any	O	O
suggestions	O	O
?	O	O

How	O	O
would	O	O
I	O	O
declare	O	O
an	O	O
array	O	B-Data_Structure
in	O	O
Swift	O	B-Language
which	O	O
can	O	O
hold	O	O
values	O	O
of	O	O
any	O	O
enum	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type

Many	O	O
Thanks	O	O
in	O	O
advance	O	O

When	O	O
you	O	O
use	O	O
server	O	B-Application
side	O	O
rendering	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
cannot	O	O
close	O	O

"	O	O
chain	O	O
"	O	O

is	O	O

does	O	O

this	O	O

the	O	O

and	O	O

(	O	O
at	O	O
leas	O	O
the	O	O

inside	O	O
your	O	O
HTML	O	B-Language
view	O	O
)	O	O
in	O	O
a	O	O

response	O	O
.	O	O

ajax	O	B-Function
requests	O	O
you	O	O
do	O	O
after	O	O
that	O	O
will	O	O
not	O	O

initially	O	O

your	O	O
response	O	O
because	O	O
this	O	O
variables	O	O
are	O	O
populated	O	O
when	O	O
the	O	O
render()	O	B-Function
function	O	O
is	O	O
called	O	O
.	O	O

that	O	O
moment	O	O

you	O	O
cannot	O	O
add	O	O
or	O	O
update	O	O

variables	O	O
that	O	O
were	O	O
sent	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
HTML	O	B-Language
template	O	O
.	O	O

backend	O	O

and	O	O
moving	O	O
to	O	O
a	O	O
more	O	O
complete	O	O
frontend	O	O
framework	O	O

when	O	O

the	O	O

request	O	O
.	O	O

wants	O	O
to	O	O

the	O	O
request	O	O
on	O	O
the	O	O
UI	O	O
thread	O	O
.	O	O

default	O	O

for	O	O
stopping	O	O
the	O	O
connection	O	O
is	O	O

seconds	O	O
so	O	O

timeout	O	O

thread	O	O
is	O	O
unblocked	O	O

execution	O	O

.	O	O

can	O	O
be	O	O
worked	O	O
around	O	O
by	O	O
invoking	O	O
stop	O	O
asynchronously	O	O

loading	O	O
strategy	O	O
really	O	O
improve	O	O
the	O	O
performances	O	O
?	O	O

Lazy-loading	O	B-Algorithm
seems	O	O
most	O	O
suitable	O	O
for	O	O
smaller	O	O
apps	O	O
without	O	O
separate	O	O
data	O	O
layers	O	O
.	O	O

Once	O	O
the	O	O
app	O	O
grows	O	O
and	O	O
you	O	O
start	O	O
separating	O	O
it	O	O
into	O	O
separate	O	O
layers	O	O
,	O	O
lazy	O	B-Algorithm
loading	O	I-Algorithm
becomes	O	O
less	O	O
useful	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
DBcontext	O	B-Class
has	O	O
long	O	O
since	O	O
been	O	O
destroyed	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
time	O	O
the	O	O
data	O	O
gets	O	O
to	O	O
the	O	O
UI	O	O
layer	O	O
,	O	O
and	O	O
while	O	O
you	O	O
are	O	O
within	O	O
the	O	O
datalayer	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
not	O	O
a	O	O
big	O	O
deal	O	O
to	O	O
specify	O	O
the	O	O
properites	O	O
to	O	O
load	O	O
.	O	O

Lazy	O	B-Algorithm
loading	O	I-Algorithm
is	O	O
turned	O	O
off	O	O
for	O	O
validation	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
if	O	O
a	O	O
property	O	O
is	O	O
marked	O	O
as	O	O
required	O	O
and	O	O
you	O	O
have	O	O
only	O	O
loaded	O	O
the	O	O
parent	O	O
an	O	O
error	O	O
will	O	O
always	O	O
be	O	O
thrown	O	O
which	O	O
is	O	O
very	O	O
frustrating	O	O
.	O	O

Lazy	O	B-Algorithm
loading	O	I-Algorithm
also	O	O
makes	O	O
debugging	O	O
rather	O	O
tricky	O	O
as	O	O
the	O	O
query	O	O
isnt	O	O
executed	O	O
until	O	O
it	O	O
is	O	O
used	O	O
so	O	O
you	O	O
ca	O	O

examine	O	O
the	O	O
results	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
query	O	O
as	O	O
easily	O	O
.	O	O

I	O	O
usually	O	O
add	O	O
a	O	O
ToList()	O	B-Function
or	O	O
similar	O	O
to	O	O
my	O	O
EF	O	O
queries	O	O
so	O	O

can	O	O
easily	O	O
examine	O	O
the	O	O
results	O	O
.	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

for	O	O
your	O	O

!	O	O

Optional	B-Code_Block	B-Data_Type
has	O	O
an	O	O
==	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
operator	O	O
defined	O	O
for	O	O
it	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
Swift	O	B-Language
standard	O	O
library	O	O
:	O	O

means	O	O

the	O	O
optional	O	B-Data_Type

a	O	O
value	O	O

optionals	O	B-Data_Type
.	O	O

two	O	O
optionals	O	B-Data_Type
are	O	O

that	O	O

they	O	O
're	O	O
equal	O	O
.	O	O

if	O	O

do	O	O

care	O	O
about	O	O
whether	O	O
person.name	B-Code_Block	B-Variable
is	O	O
nil	B-Code_Block	B-Value
or	O	O
not	O	O

just	O	O
whether	O	O
it	O	O
contains	O	O
a	O	O
value	O	O
of	O	O
"	O	B-Value
John	O	I-Value
"	O	I-Value
,	O	O
you	O	O
can	O	O
just	O	O
write	O	O
if	B-Code_Block	B-Code_Block
person.name	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block
==	I-Code_Block	I-Code_Block

.	O	O

does	O	O

"	O	B-Value

is	O	O
a	O	O

not	O	O
a	O	O

.	O	O

You	O	O
could	O	O

by	O	O
following	O	O
code	O	O
,	O	O
please	O	O
use	O	O
it	O	O
inside	O	O
an	O	O

controller	O	O

cannot	O	O

that	O	O

Json	B-Code_Block	B-Function

already	O	O

.	O	O

is	O	O

:	O	O

what	O	O
is	O	O

this	O	O
format	O	O

a	O	O

.	O	O

Adam	O	B-User_Name

some	O	O

is	O	O
the	O	O
code	O	O
example	O	O

XAML	O	B-Language

,	O	O
i	O	O
want	O	O
to	O	O

pre(post)init	O	B-Function

,	O	O

Here	O	O
is	O	O
a	O	O
DRY	O	O
way	O	O
of	O	O
dismissing	O	O
signals	O	O
.	O	O

you	O	O
want	O	O
to	O	O
dismiss	O	O
a	O	O

to	O	O
avoid	O	O
recursion	O	O
,	O	O
a	O	O
simple	O	O
way	O	O
to	O	O
go	O	O
is	O	O
to	O	O
set	O	O
an	O	O

on	O	O
the	O	O
current	O	O
instance	O	O
to	O	O
prevent	O	O
upcoming	O	O
signals	O	O
firing	O	O
.	O	O

can	O	O
be	O	O
done	O	O
using	O	O
a	O	O
simple	O	O
decorator	O	O

which	O	O

"	B-Code_Block	O

between	I-Code_Block	O

#2	O	O

's	O	O
a	O	O
method	O	O

fast	B-Code_Block	O

Benchmarking	O	O

Benchmark	O	O
results	O	O
-	O	O

Quick	O	O
conclusions	O	O
:	O	O
The	O	O
runtimes	O	O
with	O	O
Shai	O	B-User_Name
's	O	O
second	O	O
approach	O	O
that	O	O
was	O	O
a	O	O
combination	O	O
of	O	O
bsxfun	B-Code_Block	B-Function
and	O	O
matrix	O	B-Data_Structure
multiplication	O	O
were	O	O
very	O	O
close	O	O
with	O	O
the	O	O
one	O	O
based	O	O
on	O	O
pdist2	B-Code_Block	B-Function
and	O	O
no	O	O
clear	O	O
winner	O	O
could	O	O
be	O	O
decided	O	O
between	O	O
those	O	O
two	O	O
.	O	O

You	O	O
can	O	O
do	O	O
it	O	O
with	O	O
bsxfun	B-Code_Block	B-Function
:	O	O

I	O	O
know	O	O
how	O	O
to	O	O
detect	O	O
mousedown	O	B-Class
event	O	I-Class
on	O	O
a	O	O
directive	O	O
that	O	O
is	O	O
clicked	O	O
.	O	O

However	O	O
my	O	O
directive	O	O
also	O	O
needs	O	O
to	O	O
become	O	O
unforcused	O	O
or	O	O
deselected	O	O
when	O	O
mouse	O	B-Device
is	O	O
down	O	O
outside	O	O
of	O	O
my	O	O
directive/	O	O
element	O	O
.	O	O

How	O	O
can	O	O
I	O	O
do	O	O
this	O	O
?	O	O

Create	O	O
a	O	O
link	O	O
function	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
directive	O	O
which	O	O
binds	O	O
a	O	O
mousedown	O	B-Class
event	O	I-Class
handler	O	I-Class
on	O	O
the	O	O
document	O	O
.	O	O

Then	O	O
,	O	O
bind	O	O
another	O	O
mousedown	O	B-Class
event	O	I-Class
on	O	O
the	O	O
directive	O	O
element	O	O
itself	O	O
.	O	O

The	O	O
latter	O	O
handler	O	O
should	O	O
also	O	O
call	O	O
event.stopPropagation()	B-Code_Block	B-Function
to	O	O
prevent	O	O
the	O	O
event	O	O
from	O	O
bubbling	O	O
all	O	O

std::string	O	B-Class

.	O	O

This	O	O
works	O	O
because	O	O
no	O	O

with	O	O
an	O	O

of	O	O

works	O	O
just	O	O
fine	O	O

is	O	O
no	O	O
other	O	O

done	O	O
by	O	O
the	O	O
stream	O	O
.	O	O

What	O	O
you	O	O
read	O	O
is	O	O
what	O	O
you	O	O
get	O	O
.	O	O

Outputting	O	O
the	O	O
string	O	B-Data_Type
does	O	O
not	O	O
change	O	O
any	O	O
of	O	O
the	O	O
codepoints	O	O
.	O	O

Now	O	O
if	O	O
you	O	O
need	O	O
to	O	O

the	O	O
text	O	O
that	O	O

a	O	O

and	O	O
gets	O	O
more	O	O

.	O	O

to	O	O

for	O	O
most	O	O

.	O	O

an	O	O

is	O	O
boost	O	O
:	O	O

http://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_38_0/libs/serialization/doc/codecvt.html	O	O

:	O	O
It	O	O
is	O	O
also	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
latest	O	O
version	O	O
of	O	O
boost	O	B-Library
1.46	O	B-Version

The	O	O
processes	O	O
is	O	O
the	O	O
same	O	O
for	O	O

.	O	O

Note	O	O
:	O	O
I	O	O

to	O	O

to	O	O
one	O	O

about	O	O
a	O	O

(	O	O

This	O	O
code	O	O
takes	O	O
practically	O	O
no	O	O
time	O	O
at	O	O
all	O	O
when	O	O
optimizing	O	O
with	O	O
-O3	O	O

What	O	O
compiler	O	B-Application
optimization	O	O
is	O	O
making	O	O
this	O	O
code	O	O
go	O	O
from	O	O
0.014	O	O
seconds	O	O
with	O	O
-O0	O	O
to	O	O
0.000000	O	O
with	O	O
-03	O	B-Code_Block

The	O	O
internal	O	O
large	O	O
loop	O	O
has	O	O
no	O	O
side	O	O
effects	O	O
since	O	O
you	O	O
're	O	O
not	O	O
using	O	O
B	O	B-Variable
anywhere	O	O
,	O	O
so	O	O
any	O	O
decent	O	O
compiler	O	B-Application
with	O	O
-O3	O	B-Code_Block
will	O	O
eliminate	O	O
it	O	O
.	O	O

To	O	O
avoid	O	O
that	O	O
,	O	O
you	O	O
could	O	O
try	O	O
to	O	O
summarize	O	O

values	O	O
and	O	O
print	O	O
out	O	O

outcome	O	O
at	O	O

end	O	O
.	O	O

Alternatively	O	O
,	O	O

some	O	O

element	O	O
from	O	O
B	O	B-Variable
might	O	O
make	O	O
the	O	O
compiler	O	B-Application
suspicious	O	O

to	O	O
avoid	O	O
that	O	O

is	O	O
hard	O	O

the	O	O

.	O	O

general	O	O

,	O	O
which	O	O

as	O	O

as	O	O

I	O	O

is	O	O
one	O	O

feel	O	O

I	O	O
am	O	O
programming	O	O
in	O	O

in	O	O
Ubuntu	O	B-Operating_System
.	O	O

I	O	O
am	O	O
trying	O	O
to	O	O
develop	O	O
a	O	O
framework	O	O
to	O	O
solve	O	O
mathematical	O	O
problems	O	O
using	O	O
a	O	O
Population	O	B-Class
of	O	O
candidate	O	O

,	O	O
which	O	O
should	O	O
evolve	O	O
into	O	O
the	O	O
true	O	O
solution	O	O
.	O	O

There	O	O
are	O	O
3	O	O
classes	O	O
involved	O	O
:	O	O
Population	O	B-Class
,	O	O
PopulationMember	O	B-Class
and	O	O
Problem	O	B-Class
:	O	O

Usually	O	O
my	O	O
program	O	O
runs	O	O
in	O	O
loops	O	O
,	O	O
where	O	O
the	O	O
population	O	B-Class
calls	O	O
its	O	O
various	O	O
methods	O	O
.	O	O

One	O	O
of	O	O
them	O	O
is	O	O
Population::evaluate()	O	B-Function
.	O	O

My	O	O
program	O	O
ran	O	O
great	O	O
until	O	O
I	O	O
introduced	O	O
some	O	O
new	O	O
methods	O	O
of	O	O
Population	O	B-Class
.	O	O

Then	O	O
I	O	O
get	O	O
a	O	O
segmentation	O	B-Error_Name
error	O	O
in	O	O
the	O	O
middle	O	O
